actionCalls.description: Sends an email to the current Claim Member in the loop with a notification that a fellow colleague has started his/her claim process.
actionCalls.name: ClaimTeamNotification
actionCalls.label: Claim Team Notification

actionCalls.description: This is an email to the Eligible Sales Lead to notify them that a Claim has been started where they are set as Eligible Sales Lead, whereas they are not the current manager (and thus approver).
actionCalls.name: EligibleSalesLeadNotification
actionCalls.label: Eligible Sales Lead Notification

actionCalls.description:
Here the Claim Member is submitted for Approval. IMPORTANT HERE, there is NO approval process linked as there is currently only ONE on Claim Member. If this ever changes, this requires attention.
Also, there are Entry Criteria for the Approval Process such as the Status being either 'Submitted', 'Recalled' or 'Denied' and the Claim Member being 'Eligible for Claim' except for SDR ^& Exception Claims.
actionCalls.name: SubmitClaimMemberForApproval
actionCalls.label: Submit Claim Member for Approval

assignments.description: All the record variables for each unique Claim Member are added to a collection, so we can update them at once.
assignments.name: AddToCollection
assignments.label: Add to Collection

assignments.description: If this is an Exception Request for multiple Claim Members that were assigned in the Exception Screen, this assignment will be used to assign values to 3 separate Claim Member record variables. The lookups Account, User, Claim, Opportunity & Owner are assigned, also the Record Type is set to 'Exception', Status to 'No Claim Started' and percentages are updated based on the input in the Exception screen.
assignments.name: AssignClaimMembers
assignments.label: Assign Claim Members

assignments.description: We add the email address of the current Claim Member we're looping over to a collection-variable which will be used in the next element to send an email.
assignments.name: AssignEmailAddresses
assignments.label: Assign Email Addresses

assignments.description: In this assignment we use record variables for each unique Claim Member and assign the chosen percentage to them.
assignments.name: AssignNewPercentages1
assignments.label: Assign New Percentages 1 CM

assignments.description: In this assignment we use record variables for each unique Claim Member and assign the chosen percentage to them.
assignments.name: AssignNewPercentages2
assignments.label: Assign New Percentages 2 CM

assignments.description: In this assignment we use record variables for each unique Claim Member and assign the chosen percentage to them.
assignments.name: AssignNewPercentages3
assignments.label: Assign New Percentages 3 CM

assignments.description: In this assignment we use record variables for each unique Claim Member and assign the chosen percentage to them.
assignments.name: AssignNewPercentages4
assignments.label: Assign New Percentages 4 CM

assignments.description: Adds the Claim Member record variable where values were assigned to in the Assignment 'Assign Claim Members' to a collection, which will be created in the following node.
assignments.name: AssignOneClaimMember
assignments.label: Assign one Claim Member

assignments.description: Adds three Claim Member record variables where values were assigned to in the Assignment 'Assign Claim Members' to a collection, which will be created in the following node.
assignments.name: AssignThreeClaimMembers
assignments.label: Assign three Claim Members

assignments.description: Adds two Claim Member record variables where values were assigned to in the Assignment 'Assign Claim Members' to a collection, which will be created in the following node.
assignments.name: AssignTwoClaimMembers
assignments.label: Assign two Claim Members

assignments.description: This assignment counts the number of uploaded files which is done via an 'Equals Count' operator taking the number of unique uploads in the collection variable 'varUploadedFiles'.
assignments.name: AssignUploadCount
assignments.label: Assign Upload Count

assignments.description: Set a couple of variables that are used later in the flow as validations or criteria: - varNumberOfEligibleClaimMembers is the number of Eligible Regular Claim Members which is used to determine whether Regular Claim is allowed and in specification of an Alternative Split. - varCollectionOfCountries is the total list of Claim Member Areas on the Regular Claim Members used for the formula below - varNumberOfUniqueCountries is the total of unique Claim Member Areas on the Claim Members, which is used to validate whether Regular Claim is allowed. - varClaimMemberPercentageBreakdown is the combination of percentage splits from high to low of the Claim Members, used to prevent query of the current Split Deal when someone chooses alternative split later in this flow.
assignments.name: CountNumberOfClaimMembers
assignments.label: Count Number of Claim Members

assignments.description: This is only to ensure that Claim Members are created, also when flow is closed in next screen, because otherwise a rollback happens.
assignments.name: EnsureCreationOfClaimMembers
assignments.label: Ensure Creation of Claim Members

assignments.description: In this assignment the collection variable is being emptied again to prevent that in the next iteration of the loop, the first Claim Member that was looped over is receiving another notification (and to prevent the 5 recipients limit is still being hit).
assignments.name: RemoveEmailAddress
assignments.label: Remove Email Address

choices.name: choNoOpportunity
choices.choiceText: Don't relate to an Opportunity

decisions.description: Decision to check if we need to retrieve an existing Claim Member, which happens if 'Current Claim Member is valid' is TRUE. This would mean it's either Regular Claim where there should always be an existing Claim Member for the user in order to continue OR it's an exception and an existing Claim Member was chosen in the first screen. If a new IPP Advance Claim was started, we need to query afterwards whether an open regular Claim Member for this user exists as you can only claim IPP Advance in advance of a Regular Claim.
decisions.name: CheckForCurrentClaimMember
decisions.label: Check for Current Claim Member

rules.name: CheckWhetherPOSAdvanceIsAllowed
rules.label: Check whether IPP Advance is Allowed

decisions.description: Decision that first checks whether only unique Claim Members were chosen in the dividing screen. If not, it brings you back to the previous screen. If correctly selected, it needs to check the number of eligible Claim Members to correctly assign the percentages.
decisions.name: ClaimMembersSelected
decisions.label: Claim Members Selected?

decisions.description: Decision to see whether the user choose an alternative split. If so, the split needs to be divided.
decisions.name: DecidedForAlternativeSplit
decisions.label: Decided for Alternative Split?

decisions.description: Decision based on the isNotClaimable__c checkbox on Account to validate if the Account can be claimed or not.
decisions.name: decIsAccountClaimable
decisions.label: dec Is Account Claimable

decisions.description: This decision checks whether the current claim concerns an Exception Claim, but not of the type 'IPP Advance' or 'Issuing Incentive'. If so, the user could have submitted an Exception Request in advance and can link that in the next screen to skip the step of uploading evidence.
decisions.name: decisionExceptionClaim
decisions.label: Exception Claim?

decisions.description: Decision to see if a Claim record already exists. This could be the case if a Regular Claim is done by a second, third or fourth user, or when someone is part of an Exception that holds multiple Claim Members.
decisions.name: DoesClaimExist
decisions.label: Does Claim exist?

decisions.description: Checks if the Claim Member already exists. For Regular this will always be the case, otherwise you can't reach this point. However, for Exception & SDR claims, this is the point where the Claim Member is being created for the running user (if no existing Exception Claim was chosen).
decisions.name: DoesClaimMemberExist
decisions.label: Does Claim Member exist?

decisions.description:
A couple of outcomes are tested on the Existing Claim that was retrieved in the previous GET. This determines whether details that should have been populated are not yet available and based on that we know where the flow was cut-off last time. The running user will be returned to the step where the flow was cut-off last time.
Order of execution: 1. If the Comments field on an Exception (except IPP Advance or Issuing Incentive) is empty, the Exception Screen will follow. 2. If the IPP Advance Amount is empty on an IPP Advance Exception Claim, the IPP Advance screen will follow. 3. If the PSP Reference is empty on an Issuing Incentive Exception Claim, the Issuing Incentive screen will follow. 4. If the checkpoint split checkbox is FALSE on a Regular Claim, the flow was cut-off when the user had to decide whether he/she agreed with the current split. 5. If Commitment details are empty on an Exception or Regular Claim, the flow was cut-off at the Commitment screen. 6. If all above is not true AND it's not a SDR, IPP Advance or Issuing Incentive claim, this path is followed which is used to show details around the chosen split & commitment to the current running user, just informative. 7. If nothing is true, it will query whether a file was already uploaded. If not it brings the user to the File upload screen.
decisions.name: ExistingClaimDecisions
decisions.label: Existing Claim Decisions

rules.name: NotSDRAndPOSAdvance
rules.label: Not SDR & IPP Advance & Issuing Incentive

decisions.description: Decision to check whether a File was attached to the existing Claim. If so, the user will skip the file upload screen, otherwise that will be the next screen.
decisions.name: FilesFound
decisions.label: Files Found?

decisions.description: For each type of Claim we check whether it's allowed. SDR -> Not allowed if Merchant Status is not one of the mentioned values, or when there is already a SDR claim, or the profile of the user is not one oof the mentioned values. Regular -> Not allowed if Merchant Status is not one of the mentioned values, or when the Claim Member is already in one of the mentioned values (thus in approval/approved/blocked), or there are more than 2 Claim Members, but unique countries does not equal the number of Claim Members, or there is already an Exception Claim whereas the current regular Claim Member hasn't started their claim yet, or TODAY is exceeding the last date to claim on Account, or there is no Business Model Based on Adyen Data. Exception -> Not allowed if the type is IPP Advance and neither an existing Claim Member was selected nor there is an open eligible regular Claim Member for this user, or the selected existing Claim Member in the first screen does not match the type of Exception Claim selected in that same screen.
decisions.name: IsClaimAllowed
decisions.label: Is Claim allowed?

rules.name: SdrClaimIsNotAllowed
rules.conditionLogic: 1 AND ((2 AND 3 AND 4 AND 5 AND 6 AND 7) OR 8 OR (9 AND 10))
rules.label: SDR Claim is not allowed

rules.name: RegularClaimIsNotAllowed
rules.conditionLogic: 1 AND ((2 AND 3 AND 4 AND 5 AND 6) OR 7 OR 8 OR 9 OR 10 OR 11 OR 18 OR (12 AND 13) OR (14 AND 15) OR 16 OR 17)
rules.label: Regular Claim is not allowed

decisions.description: In this decision is checked whether the Eligible Sales Lead was updated in the previous screen (in case of an Exception or SDR claim) and whether that deviates from the current manager. If so, the outcome is true and an email will be sent to the new Eligible Sales Lead in the next element. In case of Regular Claims or IPP Advance / Issuing Incentive exceptions users are not able to update the Eligible Sales Lead, so instead it's checked whether the set Eligible Sales Lead on creation of the Claim Member differs from the current Manager. If so, again an email is sent to the Eligible Sales Lead.
decisions.name: IsEslOtherThanCm
decisions.label: Is ESL other than CM?

rules.name: EslIsOtherThanCm
rules.conditionLogic: (1 AND 2 AND (3 OR 4)) OR (5 AND 6 AND (7 OR 8 OR 9))
rules.label: ESL is other than CM

decisions.description: Decision to check if File Upload was required and if so, it was also done. If not, it takes the user back to the file upload screen.
decisions.name: IsFileUploaded
decisions.label: Is File uploaded?

decisions.description: This Decision element has quite some outcomes that run in a certain order as it checks based on type of Claim and the state of it (new or existing) what path to take. Different details are necessary for the various types.
decisions.name: IsNewClaimCreated
decisions.label: Is New Claim created?

rules.name: NewPOSAdvanceClaimIsCreated
rules.label: New IPP Advance Claim is created

rules.name: NewIssuingIncentiveClaimisCreated
rules.label: New Issuing Incentive Claim is Created

decisions.description: This is a decision to see whether this concerns a Regular Claim. If so, all other Regular Claim Members on the Account need to be linked to the new Regular Claim as well and need to be moved to 'Eligible'.
decisions.name: IsRegularClaim
decisions.label: Is Regular Claim?

decisions.description: Decision to check whether the Manager field on the logged in user is assigned. If not, OR if the assigned manager is an inactive user, the outcome will lead to a screen explaining the user can't claim due to invalid or no assignment of a manager which is required for approval.
decisions.name: ManagerFieldPopulated
decisions.label: Manager field populated?

decisions.description: This decision checks how many Claim Members were named in the Exception Screen. This is done to determine how many of the Claim Member record variables from previous assignment need to be added to a collection to create them in bulk.
decisions.name: NumberOfClaimMembersToCreate
decisions.label: Number of Claim Members to create

decisions.description: A decision to check whether this is a SDR claim. If it's not a SDR claim, we're going to retrieve all Regular Claim Members and notify them that the running user has submitted his/her piece of the Account to claim.
decisions.name: WhatClaimType
decisions.label: What Claim Type?

Flow.description: Last Update: Descriptions added in all Elements

formulas.description: Determines Claim Type picklist value on Claim
formulas.name: forClaimType
forCorrectSelection
formulas.expression:
IF( {!varNumberOfEligibleClaimMembers} = 1, TRUE,
IF( {!varNumberOfEligibleClaimMembers} = 2, {!pickClaimMember1} <> {!pickClaimMember2},
IF( {!varNumberOfEligibleClaimMembers} = 3, AND( {!pickClaimMember1} <> {!pickClaimMember2}, {!pickClaimMember1} <> {!pickClaimMember3}, {!pickClaimMember2} <> {!pickClaimMember3}),
IF( {!varNumberOfEligibleClaimMembers} = 4, AND( {!pickClaimMember1} <> {!pickClaimMember2}, {!pickClaimMember1} <> {!pickClaimMember3}, {!pickClaimMember1} <> {!pickClaimMember4}, {!pickClaimMember2} <> {!pickClaimMember3}, {!pickClaimMember2} <> {!pickClaimMember4}, {!pickClaimMember3} <> {!pickClaimMember4}),
FALSE ))))

formulas.name: forCounterExceptionClaimsExclPOS
formulas.expression: IF( AND( {!LoopClaims.RecordTypeId} = {!$Label.ExceptionClaim}, TEXT({!LoopClaims.ClaimType__c}) <> 'IPP Advance', TEXT({!LoopClaims.ClaimType__c}) <> 'Issuing Incentive', {!LoopClaims.ClaimStatusFormula__c} <> 'Inactive', {!LoopClaims.ClaimStatusFormula__c} <> 'Rejected' ), 1,0)

formulas.name: forMMICountryValid
formulas.expression: OR( TEXT({!GetAccount.BillingCountryCode}) = "AT", TEXT({!GetAccount.BillingCountryCode}) = "BE", TEXT({!GetAccount.BillingCountryCode}) = "CH", TEXT({!GetAccount.BillingCountryCode}) = "DE", TEXT({!GetAccount.BillingCountryCode}) = "ES", TEXT({!GetAccount.BillingCountryCode}) = "FR", TEXT({!GetAccount.BillingCountryCode}) = "GB", TEXT({!GetAccount.BillingCountryCode}) = "IE", TEXT({!GetAccount.BillingCountryCode}) = "LU", TEXT({!GetAccount.BillingCountryCode}) = "NL", TEXT({!GetAccount.BillingCountryCode}) = "PT")

Flow.label: Commission Claiming

loops.description: Loop over ALL the Claims Members that were queried in the last element to do a couple of validations.
loops.name: LoopClaimMembers
loops.label: Loop Claim Members

loops.description: Loop over ALL the related Claims that were queried in the last element to do a couple of validations.
loops.name: LoopClaims
loops.label: Loop Claims

loops.description: We're looping over the collection of fellow Claim Members that was queried in the last element. This is done to send an email to them 1 by 1, because there is a LIMIT of only 5 recipients when using Flow Email and there are Accounts that have more than 5 regular Claim Members. To prevent hitting limits we're sending the emails 1 by 1 via this loop.
loops.name: LoopClaimTeam
loops.label: Loop Claim Team

recordCreates.description: Creates the Claim record, which is important to be able to attach the Claim Member(s) to it. The Record Type and Claim Type are dependent on the type of Claim decided in the first screen of this flow.
recordCreates.name: CreateClaim
recordCreates.label: Create Claim

recordCreates.description: This is the point where the Claim Member is being created and all Adyen Formula fields are being populated. The Claim Member is created in 'Eligible' status and this will only happen for SDR or Exception Claim Members, as Regular Claim member need to exist in advance.
recordCreates.name: CreateClaimMember
recordCreates.label: Create Claim Member

recordCreates.description: Bulk creation of the collection of Exception Claim Members that was assigned to the collection in the previous assignment. This depends on how many other Exception Claim Members were specified by the running user.
recordCreates.name: CreateExceptionClaimMembers
recordCreates.label: Create Exception Claim Members

recordLookups.description: This query is done to determine whether there are already existing open Exception Claims where this user is related to. This is likely to happen if a colleague started an Exception for multiple people. If so, this will result in a visual warning in the next screen when the user wants to start an Exception Claim, so he/she is alerted to choose an existing Claim Member to continue on. Therefore, this should use same criteria as the choClaimMembers Record Choice Set.
recordLookups.name: FindExistingExceptionClaimMember
recordLookups.label: Find Existing Exception Claim Member

recordLookups.description: Tries to find an eligible open Regular Claim Member for this User on the Account. If not found, it means the user is not eligible to do an IPP Advance claim.
recordLookups.name: FindRegularClaimMember
recordLookups.label: Find Regular Claim Member

recordLookups.description: Retrieves all fields from the Account from where the user has clicked on the 'Claim Account' button. Details are later necessary in the Flow.
recordLookups.name: GetAccount
recordLookups.label: Get Account

recordLookups.description: Query of the Files that are attached to the current Claim
recordLookups.name: GetClaimFiles
recordLookups.label: Get Claim Files

recordLookups.description: Query of ALL related Claim records on the Account which is used to do a couple of validations on various number of Claims to determine whether the process can be continued.
recordLookups.name: GetClaims
recordLookups.label: Get Claims

recordLookups.description: In this 'GET' all the other Regular Claim Members (independent of eligibility) that are linked to the Account and not yet approved are being retrieved. We're going to notify them in the next part.
recordLookups.name: GetClaimTeam
recordLookups.label: Get Claim Team

recordLookups.description: Here we GET either the chosen Exception Claim Member (varClaimMemberToBeUpdated) in the initial screen or an eligible Regular Claim Member for the Account. We need those details to verify whether claiming is allowed and in order to update the Claim Member record in this flow.
recordLookups.name: GetCurrentClaimMember
recordLookups.label: Get Current Claim Member

recordLookups.description:
Query of ALL related eligible regular Claim Member records on the Account which is used to do a couple of validations on various number of Claim Members to determine whether the process can be continued.
This is DESCENDING on Percentage as this is necessary to match on Split Breakdown on the Split Deal Records
recordLookups.name: GetEligibleRegularClaimMembers
recordLookups.label: Get eligible Regular Claim Members

recordLookups.description: This query retrieves the User that is the Eligible Sales Lead as we need his/her email to notify them that a claim has been started where they are eligible sales lead.
recordLookups.name: GetEligibleSalesLead
recordLookups.label: Get Eligible Sales Lead

recordLookups.description: This path is only taken when varCreatedClaimId is empty, which means that no new Claim was created during the current flow run. For that reason, the existing claim is retrieved to validate whether the flow was already finished last time or details are missing. This is also the path that will be taken when a second Claim Member on a Claim (Regular or Exception) is running the flow.
recordLookups.name: GetExistingClaim
recordLookups.label: Get Existing Claim

recordLookups.description: Query the related Claim Members from the current Claim to display the Split and Commitment details that were chosen by the user who claimed this Account for the first time.
recordLookups.name: GetRelatedClaimMembers
recordLookups.label: Get Related Claim Members

recordLookups.description: Queries all Split Deal records that are active and that equal the number of Eligible Claim Members on this Account. The Split Deal records that meets the current split is being excluded. This is based on a variable that is populated in the 'Count Number of Claim Members' Assignment.
recordLookups.name: GetSplitDeals
recordLookups.label: Get Split Deals

recordLookups.description: Retrieves details from the user who clicked the 'Claim Account' button (currently logged in user). This is necessary to retrieve details from a parent-level (manager) in the next decision.
recordLookups.name: GetUser
recordLookups.label: Get User

recordUpdates.description: This is an update on the Regular Claim record to mark the checkbox 'Checkpoint Split' to TRUE, which is used priorly in this flow in the 'Existing Claim Decisions' decision to decide whether the running user can still see the 'Choose Alternative Split' screen or not as it should NOT happen that a second, third or fourth Claim Member has the option to adjust the split again.
recordUpdates.name: SetCheckpointOnClaim
recordUpdates.label: Set Checkpoint On Claim

recordUpdates.description: If the Claim Member for the running user already existed, this is the point where the record is updated with the latest input of the Adyen Formula fields and status is moved to 'Eligible' (most often from Claim Started).
recordUpdates.name: UpdateAdyenFormulaOnClaimMember
recordUpdates.label: Update Adyen Formula on Claim Member

recordUpdates.description: This is an update of the Claim Member belonging to the running user to update the status to 'Submitted', to set a start date of the Claim and to potentially update the Eligible Sales Lead if changed in the previous screen.
recordUpdates.name: UpdateClaimMemberToSubmitted
recordUpdates.label: Update Claim Member to Submitted

recordUpdates.description: Populates the Claim lookup and updates status to 'Eligible' for all eligible Regular Claim Members on the Account that are not yet linked to the new Regular Claim (should be all Claim Members exception for the running user).
recordUpdates.name: UpdateClaimRelation
recordUpdates.label: Update Claim Relation

recordUpdates.description: In this update the commitment answers from the previous screen are updated on the Claim record. Once populated, it will not be asked again when someone starts a Claim on this Account.
recordUpdates.name: UpdateCommitmentOnClaim
recordUpdates.label: Update Commitment on Claim

recordUpdates.description: This is an update of the Exception Claim to update the Comments & Merchants text field populated in the previous screen. This is placed in between to allow users to continue the flow when closing early.
recordUpdates.name: UpdateExceptionDetailsOnClaim
recordUpdates.label: Update Exception Details on Claim

recordUpdates.description: In this update the Exception Request lookup field on Claim is updated with the Exception Request that was chosen in the last screen.
recordUpdates.name: UpdateExceptionRequestOnClaim
recordUpdates.label: Update Exception Request on Claim

recordUpdates.description: This is an update of the Exception Claim Member of the running user to ensure the details from the Issuing Incentive screen in the previous element are saved on the Claim Member.
recordUpdates.name: UpdateIssuingIncentiveonClaimMember
recordUpdates.label: Update Issuing Incentive on Claim Member

recordUpdates.description: This is an update of the Clam Member of the running user to set the Opportunity that was populated in the previous screen and update the percentage based on the previous screen.
recordUpdates.name: UpdateOpportunityOnClaimMember
recordUpdates.label: Update Opportunity on Claim Member

recordUpdates.description: This is an update of the Exception Claim Member of the running user to populate the values that were specified in the previous screen on the Claim Member. This is a prove that the Claim Member confirms the Claim meets all criteria to claim 5K or 10K in advance.
recordUpdates.name: UpdatePosAdvanceOnClaimMember
recordUpdates.label: Update IPP Advance on Claim Member

recordUpdates.description: Update of the percentages on the Claim Members based on the alternative split.
recordUpdates.name: UpdateSplitClaimMembers
recordUpdates.label: Update Split Claim Members

recordUpdates.description: This is an update on the Regular Claim record to populate the lookup to the Alternative Split that was chosen. Also a checkbox 'Checkpoint Split' is being marked as TRUE, which is used priorly in this flow in the 'Existing Claim Decisions' decision to decide whether the running user can still see the 'Choose Alternative Split' screen or not as it should NOT happen that a second, third or fourth Claim Member can adjust the split again.
recordUpdates.name: UpdateSplitDealLookupOnClaim
recordUpdates.label: Update Split Deal Lookup on Claim

fields.name: disErrorText
fields.fieldText:
Something went wrong during this process due to the following error:


{!$Flow.FaultMessage}


Please retry if you understand what goes wrong, otherwise reach out to your System Administrator.

fields.name: disErrorText2
fields.fieldText:
Something went wrong during this process due to the following error:


{!$Flow.FaultMessage}


Please retry if you understand what goes wrong, otherwise reach out to your System Administrator.

fields.name: disErrorText3
fields.fieldText:
Something went wrong during this process due to the following error:


{!$Flow.FaultMessage}


Please retry if you understand what goes wrong, otherwise reach out to your System Administrator.

fields.name: disErrorText4
fields.fieldText:
Something went wrong during this process due to the following error:


{!$Flow.FaultMessage}


Please retry if you understand what goes wrong, otherwise reach out to your System Administrator.

fields.name: disErrorText5
fields.fieldText:
Something went wrong during this process due to the following error:


{!$Flow.FaultMessage}


Please retry if you understand what goes wrong, otherwise reach out to your System Administrator.

fields.name: disErrorText5_0
fields.fieldText:
Something went wrong during this process due to the following error:


{!$Flow.FaultMessage}


Please retry if you understand what goes wrong, otherwise reach out to your System Administrator.

screens.description: Screen where user needs to populate how he/she applied the Adyen Formula Successfully and how to improve.
screens.name: scrAdyenFormula
screens.label: Adyen Formula

fields.name: disAdyenFormulaSuccess1
fields.fieldText:
Question

An example of how I applied the Adyen Formula successfully is (please select the appropriate formula from the rating drop down):

fields.name: pickRatingAdyenFormulaSuccess1
fields.fieldText: Rating

fields.name: txtAnswerAdyenFormulaSuccess1
fields.fieldText: Answer

validationRule.errorMessage: Your answer must contain at least 100 characters.

fields.name: disAdyenFormulaSuccess2
fields.fieldText:
Question

An example of how I applied the Adyen Formula successfully is (please select the appropriate formula from the rating drop down):

fields.name: pickRatingAdyenFormulaSuccess2
fields.fieldText: Rating

fields.name: txtAnswerAdyenFormulaSuccess2
fields.fieldText: Answer

validationRule.errorMessage: Your answer must contain at least 100 characters.

fields.name: disAdyenFormulaImprove
fields.fieldText:
Question

Please provide an example of how your behavior according to the Adyen Way of Selling could be improved next time:

fields.name: pickRatingAdyenFormulaImprove
fields.fieldText: Rating

fields.name: txtAnswerAdyenFormulaImprove
fields.fieldText: Answer

validationRule.errorMessage: Your answer must contain at least 100 characters.

fields.name: disMidMarket
fields.fieldText: Mid-Market Incentive

fields.name: pickClaimMidMarketIncentive
fields.fieldText: Claim Mid-Market Incentive?

fields.name: pickExceedsMMMarginThreshold
fields.fieldText: Exceeds Mid-Market Margin Threshold
fields.helpText: You need to have a pre-approval for any MM deals that have scaled beyond 30K margin.

fields.name: pickDidYouWorkWithSalesEnterpriseOnThisDeal
fields.fieldText: Did you work with Sales Enterprise on this deal?

fields.name: disThreshold
fields.fieldText: Are you aware that the claimable threshold is 1.5K - 30K EUR? For merchants coming in via Partners (using an Adyen approved integration) this threshold is 0.5K - 30K EUR.

fields.name: checkThreshold
fields.fieldText: Yes, I am

validationRule.errorMessage: You need to mark this checkbox in order to continue.

fields.name: disMidMarketIndustryAwareness
fields.fieldText:
Are you aware that the Mid-Market Incentive only applies to Accounts that are active in the following Industries?

  • Retail
  • Restaurants
  • Digital (Goods delivery, Food delivery & Streaming, Reading & Podcasting)
  • B2B (Services)

fields.name: checkAwareIndustry
fields.fieldText: Yes, I am

validationRule.errorMessage: You need to mark this checkbox in order to continue.

fields.name: disMidMarketSalesChannelAwareness
fields.fieldText: Are you aware that the Mid-Market Incentive only applies to deals that do not include IPP?

fields.name: checkSalesChannel
fields.fieldText: Yes, I am

validationRule.errorMessage: You need to mark this checkbox in order to continue.

screens.description: Final screen in which the user is notified that the flow was successfully completed and Claim is now submitted for approval.
screens.name: scrClaimMemberSubmitted
screens.label: Claim Member submitted

fields.name: disClaimMemberSubmitted
fields.fieldText: Your Claim has been submitted for approval! Please click Finish to return to the Account record.

screens.description: In this screen the running user can set whether there is a fixed commitment. If so, some follow-up questions needs to be answers. The answers are stored on the Claim record itself and are only asked to the first person claiming.
screens.name: scrCommitment
screens.label: Commitment

fields.name: pickFixedCommitment
fields.fieldText: Is there a fixed commitment?

fields.name: numCommitmentInYears
fields.fieldText: Commitment in Years

validationRule.errorMessage: There is a maximum of 2 characters for this field.

fields.name: numCommitmentInNumberOfMonthlyTransactions
fields.fieldText: Commitment in # of Monthly Transactions

fields.name: pickCurrency
fields.fieldText: Currency

fields.name: numCostsPerTransaction
fields.fieldText: Cost per Transaction

fields.name: disCommitment
fields.fieldText: Is there a commitment from before the change to a transaction commitments (before 2018), please leave the above questions blank and explain your exception below.

fields.name: txtExceptionCommitment
fields.fieldText: Exception Commitment

fields.name: disMistake3
fields.fieldText:
Note: Made a mistake on a previous screen? Close this window & open the Claim record to make changes.

Afterwards, click on the Claim button again to continue.

screens.description: Screen in which the running user can divide the chosen alternative split amongst all eligible Regular Claim Members. The number of Claim Members shown here depends on the number of eligible Claim Members and is set up with visibility filters. You need to select unique Claim Members in the overview, otherwise you'll be brought back to this screen and the error shows.
screens.name: scrDivideNewSplit
screens.label: Divide New Split

fields.name: displErrorIncorrectSelection
fields.fieldText: Error: You need to select a unique Claim Member per Split %. Try again and press 'Next'

fields.name: dispSelectedSplitDivide
fields.fieldText: You have selected {!tableAlternativeSplit.firstSelectedRow.Name} as alternative split. Now divide this over the eligible Claim Members:

fields.name: displPercentageHeader
fields.fieldText: Percentage

fields.name: displSplitPercentage1
fields.fieldText: {!tableAlternativeSplit.firstSelectedRow.Split1__c}%

fields.name: displSplitPercentage2
fields.fieldText: {!tableAlternativeSplit.firstSelectedRow.Split2__c}%

fields.name: displSplitPercentage3
fields.fieldText: {!tableAlternativeSplit.firstSelectedRow.Split3__c}%

fields.name: displSplitPercentage4
fields.fieldText: {!tableAlternativeSplit.firstSelectedRow.Split4__c}%

fields.name: displRoleHeader
fields.fieldText: Role

fields.name: displRole1
fields.fieldText: {!tableAlternativeSplit.firstSelectedRow.Role1__c}

fields.name: displRole2
fields.fieldText: {!tableAlternativeSplit.firstSelectedRow.Role2__c}

fields.name: displRole3
fields.fieldText: {!tableAlternativeSplit.firstSelectedRow.Role3__c}

fields.name: displRole4
fields.fieldText: {!tableAlternativeSplit.firstSelectedRow.Role4__c}

fields.name: displClaimMemberHeader
fields.fieldText: Claim Member

fields.name: pickClaimMember1
fields.fieldText: Claim Member

fields.name: pickClaimMember2
fields.fieldText: Claim Member

fields.name: pickClaimMember3
fields.fieldText: Claim Member

fields.name: pickClaimMember4
fields.fieldText: Claim Member

screens.description: Screen which is used to provide additional details on the Exception. Only used for 'Different Split Percentage', 'Merchant Account Claim' and 'Other' Exceptions. There are some visibility filters based on the type of Exception.
screens.name: scrExceptionClaim
screens.label: Exception Claim

fields.name: disExceptionDisclaimer
fields.fieldText: You need to submit proof of that you have an approval for this exception.

fields.name: txtExceptionComments
fields.fieldText: Comments
fields.helpText: Please add here the context of your exception request (i.e. an approved merchant claim)

fields.name: txtMerchants
fields.fieldText: Merchants
fields.helpText: In the case of requesting a 'merchant exception claim', please specify all the correct Backoffice accountnames of the merchant accounts in scope. Missing and / or incorrect spelled accounts wont be processed.

fields.name: numNumberOfInvolvedClaimMembers
fields.fieldText: Number of involved Claim Members (including myself)

fields.name: disFirstClaimMember
fields.fieldText:
First Claim Member

{!forCurrentUserName}

fields.name: numFirstClaimMemberPercentage
fields.fieldText: First Claim Member Percentage

fields.name: numSecondClaimMemberPercentage
fields.fieldText: Second Claim Member Percentage

fields.name: numThirdClaimMemberPercentage
fields.fieldText: Third Claim Member Percentage

fields.name: numFourthClaimMemberPercentage
fields.fieldText: Fourth Claim Member Percentage

fields.name: pickOpportunity
fields.fieldText: Opportunity

fields.name: disMistake2
fields.fieldText: Note: Made a mistake on a previous screen? You can close this window and use the Claim button again to populate other values.

screens.description: Screen with all reasons why an Exception claim may not be allowed. The warnings are shown based on visibility filters.
screens.name: scrExceptionClaimNotAllowed
screens.label: Exception Claim Not Allowed

fields.name: displNotAllowedException
fields.fieldText: You did not pass the validation to start an Exception Claim. Below you find the reason(s) why. If this is something you cannot solve or do not agree with, please reach out to salesforce-claims@adyen.com

fields.name: errorNoRegularClaimMemberFound
fields.fieldText: Warning: To submit a IPP Advance Claim you need to be an eligible Claim Member on the Account.

fields.name: errorDifferentTypeOfExceptionClaim
fields.fieldText: Warning: You have chosen to continue with an existing Exception Claim, but its Claim Type '{!GetCurrentClaimMember.Claim__r.ClaimType__c}' differs from the Claim Type that you chose in the first screen: '{!radTypeOfExceptionClaim}'. If you want to continue with an existing Claim, please ensure you choose the same Exception Claim Type.

screens.description: In this screen the user can set whether he/she received approved on an Exception Request in advance. If 'Yes', the user can choose from a list of approved Exception Request where this used is an Exception Request Member. The requirement to upload files will then be skipped.
screens.name: scrExceptionRequest
screens.label: ExceptionRequest

fields.name: disExceptionRequest
fields.fieldText:
Exception Request


Did you get approval on an Exception Request for the Account {!GetAccount.Name}? If so, please choose the Exception Request below, by doing so you don't need to upload other evidence that you are eligible to claim this Account.

fields.name: pickReceivedApprovalExceptionRequest
fields.fieldText: I received approval on an Exception Request

fields.name: pickMyApprovedExceptionRequest
fields.fieldText: My Approved Exception Request
fields.helpText: If you don't see any options to choose from, it means there are no approved Exception Request where you are part of on the Account. Choose 'No' on the option above and upload evidence in the next screen.

fields.name: disMistake4_0
fields.fieldText:
Note: Made a mistake on a previous screen? Close this window & open the Claim record to make changes.

Afterwards, click on the Claim button again to continue.

screens.description: Screen which provides a promp to the user that a file upload is required and was not done and it's going to bring the user back to the File Upload screen.
screens.name: scrFileUploadFailed
screens.label: File Upload Failed

fields.name: disFileUploadFailed
fields.fieldText: You did not upload documents in the previous screen screen. Click the Next button to enter the Upload Documents screen again.

screens.description:
This screen is specifically for Issuing Incentive claims and forces the user to confirm the deal meets all the requirements for this incentive. If checkboxes are not marked as TRUE, they can't continue.
Additionally, a PSP reference & a transacting Opportunity with Sales Channel 'Issuing' needs to be linked.
screens.name: scrIssuingIncentive
screens.label: Issuing Incentive

fields.name: chkContractSignedPeriod
fields.fieldText: I confirm that the contract was signed between May 1, 2022 and December 31, 2023. (Well ask you for a screenshot in the next step!)

validationRule.errorMessage: You need to mark this checkbox in order to continue.

fields.name: chkProcessing3MMonthly
fields.fieldText: I confirm that the Merchant will process at least EUR 3M per month.

validationRule.errorMessage: You need to mark this checkbox in order to continue.

fields.name: chkLiveWithTransactions
fields.fieldText: I confirm that the Merchant is Live with real transactions.

validationRule.errorMessage: You need to mark this checkbox in order to continue.

fields.name: PSP_Reference
fields.fieldText: PSP Reference

fields.name: OpportunityMustExist
fields.fieldText: If you don't see any opportunity that means you do not have a Transacting opportunity with Sales Channel = Issuing.

fields.name: pickIssuingOpportunity
fields.fieldText: Opportunity

screens.description:
This screen allows users to choose an alternative split if they don't agree with the standard one. Some of these elements only show dependent on the number of Claim Members, e.g. you can't select an alternative split if you are the only eligible Claim Member.
The table with alternative splits only show Split Deal records that meet the same number of Claim Members and excludes the current split.
screens.name: scrOptionToChooseAlternativeSplit
screens.label: Option to Choose Alternative Split

fields.name: displExplanation
fields.fieldText: Please check the table below with the eligible Claim Members and decide whether you agree with the split or want to choose an alternative. You can only make this selection once, so be careful.

fields.name: displExplanation1User
fields.fieldText:
It seems that you are the only eligible Claim Member on this Account, is this correct?

  • If not, close this window and let us know via an email to salesforce-claims@adyen.com
  • If correct, you can continue by pressing next

fields.name: pickChooseOtherSplit
fields.fieldText: Choose Other Split?

fields.name: dispSelectSplitBelow
fields.fieldText: Select an alternative split from the table below.

fields.name: chkInformedOtherClaimMembers
fields.fieldText: I have informed the other Claim Members and they all agree on the new split

validationRule.errorMessage: You can only continue if you aligned and agreed on the new split with your fellow Claim Members

fields.name: displMistake
fields.fieldText: Note: Not sure what to select? Your progress is saved, so you can close this window and use the Claim button again to return to this point.

screens.description:
This screen is specifically for IPP Advance claims and forces the user to confirm the deal meets all the requirements for IPP Advance. If checkboxes are not marked as TRUE, they can't continue.
The values are also updated on the Claim Member afterwards.
screens.name: scrPosAdvance
screens.label: IPP Advance

fields.name: chkAccountNotFullyLive
fields.fieldText: The account is not yet fullly live and it will take some time before the rollout is complete.

validationRule.errorMessage: You need to mark this checkbox in order to continue.

fields.name: chk75PctComingFromPointOfSale
fields.fieldText: 75% of the merchant its volume coming from In-Person Payments.

validationRule.errorMessage: You need to mark this checkbox in order to continue.

fields.name: txtMarginJustifyingAdvanceClaim
fields.fieldText: The expected margin justifying an advance claim. Please specify.

fields.name: chkMoreThan75Terminals
fields.fieldText: The agreements with the merchant includes a minimal commitment of 75 terminals.

validationRule.errorMessage: You need to mark this checkbox in order to continue.

fields.name: chkAgreementSigned
fields.fieldText: The agreement is signed.

validationRule.errorMessage: You need to mark this checkbox in order to continue.

fields.name: pickPosAdvanceAmount
fields.fieldText: I'm claiming 5000 or 10000 EUR in advance

fields.name: chkAwareClaimSubmittedWithin24Months
fields.fieldText: I'm aware that the original claim needs to be submitted within 24 months, and if not it will automatically start running in a year.

validationRule.errorMessage: You need to mark this checkbox in order to continue.

fields.name: disMistake1
fields.fieldText: Note: Made a mistake on a previous screen? You can close this window and use the Claim button again to populate other values.

screens.description: In this screen we summarize some details that we know so far which were populated by the person who claimed first. This is read-only and just to inform the second, third and sometimes even fourth user that is eligible on the Claim. There are visibility filters as the Adjusted Split is only shown when also chosen, similarly for Commitment details and Exception details.
screens.name: scrReadOnlyClaimDetails
screens.label: Read-Only Claim Details

fields.name: disIntroScreen
fields.fieldText:
Details of the Claim were already populated in a previous stage by you or a colleague. You can find details below:


  • Created by: {!GetExistingClaim.CreatedBy.FirstName} {!GetExistingClaim.CreatedBy.LastName} 
  • Created on: {!GetExistingClaim.CreatedDate}
  • Fixed Commitment: {!GetExistingClaim.FixedCommitment__c}

fields.name: disCommitmentDetails
fields.fieldText:
• Commitment in Years: {!GetExistingClaim.CommitmentInYears__c}
  • Commitment in # of Monthly Transactions: {!GetExistingClaim.CommittedTransactions__c}
  • Currency: {!GetExistingClaim.CurrencyIsoCode}
  • Costs per Transaction: {!GetExistingClaim.CostsPerTransaction__c}

fields.name: disExceptionDetails
fields.fieldText:
Exception Request Comments:

{!GetExistingClaim.Comments__c}


Exception Claim Merchants:

{!GetExistingClaim.Merchants__c}

fields.name: displAlternativeSplit
fields.fieldText:
Adjusted Split:

An alternative split was chosen: {!GetExistingClaim.AlternativeSplit__r.Name}

screens.description: Screen with all reasons why a Regular claim may not be allowed. The warnings are shown based on visibility filters.
screens.name: scrRegularClaimNotAllowed
screens.label: Regular Claim not allowed

fields.name: errorOverview
fields.fieldText: You did not pass the validation to start a Regular Claim. Below you find the reason(s) why. If this is something you cannot solve or do not agree with, please reach out to salesforce-claims@adyen.com

fields.name: errorRegularClaimNotLiveAccount
fields.fieldText: Warning: You can only claim Live Accounts.

fields.name: errorRegularClaimNotResubmitted
fields.fieldText: Warning: It is not allowed to resubmit a Claim.

fields.name: errorRegularClaimCountrySetupIncorrect
fields.fieldText: Warning: When a Claim contains more than 2 eligible Claim Members, all eligible Claim Members should be from different Claim Member Areas. Therefore, your request cannot be processed. Please contact your administrator to correct eligibility of Claim Members.

fields.name: errorRegularClaimMemberDoesNotExist
fields.fieldText: Warning: You are not eligible to start a Regular Claim. If this is a mistake, please contact your administrator to correct eligibility of Claim Members.

fields.name: errorRegularClaimAlreadyClaimed
fields.fieldText: Warning: You are not allowed to create a Regular Claim because the Account has at least one Exception Claim (IPP Advance excluded).

fields.name: errorBlockedByException
fields.fieldText: Warning: You are not allowed to create a Regular Claim because you already were approved on an Exception Claim.

fields.name: errorClaimPeriodExceeded
fields.fieldText: Warning: You are not allowed to create a Regular Claim because you have exceeded the last allowed quarter to Claim on this Account. Your last quarter to claim was: {!GetAccount.Last_Quarter_to_Claim__c}.

fields.name: errorBusinessModelisBlank
fields.fieldText: Warning: You are not allowed to create a Regular Claim because the following field is blank on the Account that you are about to Claim: Business Model Based on Adyen Data.

fields.name: errorNoLiveDate
fields.fieldText: Warning: You are not allowed to claim as the Account has no Live Date. This value should be synced from the BackOffice.

screens.description: Screen with all reasons why a SDR claim may not be allowed. The warnings are shown based on visibility filters.
screens.name: scrSdrClaimNotAllowed
screens.label: SDR Claim not allowed

fields.name: displNotAllowedSDR
fields.fieldText: You did not pass the validation to start a SDR Claim. Below you find the reason(s) why. If this is something you cannot solve or do not agree with, please reach out to salesforce-claims@adyen.com

fields.name: disSdrClaimNotProspectOrLiveAccount
fields.fieldText: Warning: You can only claim Prospect Accounts or Live Accounts.

fields.name: disSdrClaimNotSalesSupportUk
fields.fieldText: Warning: You are not allowed to create an SDR Claim when you don't have a Sales Support Role.

fields.name: disSdrClaimOnlyOneSdrClaim
fields.fieldText: Warning: You are not allowed to create a second SDR Claim on the Account.

screens.description: In this screen the user can change the Eligible Sales Lead for SDR and Exception Claims. This is not possible for Regular Claims where eligible Sales Lead is set on creation of them. This is the last screen before approval.
screens.name: scrSubmitClaimForApproval
screens.label: Submit Claim for approval

fields.name: disEligibleSalesLead
fields.fieldText: By default, the Eligible Sales Lead is set to your manager, based on the data known in Salesforce it is ({!GetUser.Manager__c}). This is the Team Lead who will receive the related Sales Team Lead Commission for this deal/claim. If this is incorrect please enter the correct Eligible Sales Lead to be rewarded.

fields.name: pickCorrectEligibleSalesLead
fields.fieldText: Do you want to update the Eligible Sales Lead?

fields.name: disSubmitClaimForApproval
fields.fieldText: Warning: After clicking the Next button, your claim request will be submitted for approval. Click the Next button if you are sure you want to submit your claim request.

fields.name: disMistake5
fields.fieldText:
Note: Made a mistake on a previous screen? Close this window & open the Claim record to make changes.

Afterwards, click on the Claim button again to continue.

screens.description: Main screen in which user selects the type of Claim. If Exception is chosen, a type of exception needs to be selected as well and potentially existing open Exception Claims for this user are shown to select from.
screens.name: scrTypeOfClaim
screens.label: Type of Claim

fields.name: radTypeOfClaim
fields.fieldText: What type of Claim do you want to submit?

fields.name: radTypeOfExceptionClaim
fields.fieldText: Type of Exception Claim

fields.name: disExceptionClaimMemberFound
fields.fieldText:
Attention:

At least one open Exception Claim related to your user for this Account was found. Ensure you choose this Claim from the radio buttons below when you want to continue with that Claim. Click on the Claim Name to see more details.

fields.name: radSelectClaim
fields.fieldText: Please select the Claim that you would like to submit.

fields.name: disStartClaim
fields.fieldText: {!txtStartClaim}

screens.description:
In this screen the user is prompted with an explanation whether additional attachments are necessary to continue the Claim. There are various reasons to require the upload of files and these are shown based on visibility filters. Using a formula variable in the next element, we determine whether file upload was required and actually done. If not, we navigate back to this screen.
If you ADD or REMOVE reasons, you need to keep in mind to update the formula variable as well, which also determines whether the text 'You are not required to upload files' shows at the bottom of this screen.
screens.name: scrUploadFiles
screens.label: Upload Files

fields.name: NoFilesAvailable
fields.fieldText:
Uploading Files


In this screen you can upload all the required files for your claim request. Below you can read whether you are required to upload a file or whether this is optional.


Note: You won't see any preview when you upload files below, but they will be added to your Claim record.



Requested Files

fields.name: disProofException
fields.fieldText: Required: Please provide evidence that you have received approval from the CCO to submit an Exception Claim for this account (such as a screenshot of an email with the approval).

fields.name: disProofSdr
fields.fieldText: Required: Please provide any extra evidence needed to submit an SDR Claim for this account.

fields.name: disProofCommitment
fields.fieldText: Required: Please provide evidence that the commitment has been configured and activated on this account (such as a screenshot of the backoffice).

fields.name: disProofPosAdvance
fields.fieldText: Required: Please provide evidence that you have received approval from the CCO to submit a IPP Advance Claim on this account (such as a screenshot of an email with the approval).

fields.name: disProofIssuingIncentive
fields.fieldText: Required: Please provide a screenshot of the signed contract with date and signature included.

fields.name: disNoFilesRequired
fields.fieldText: You are not required to upload files.

value.stringValue: Add files related to your claim

fields.name: disMistake4
fields.fieldText:
Note: Made a mistake on a previous screen? Close this window & open the Claim record to make changes.

Afterwards, click on the Claim button again to continue.

screens.description: Screen that shows potential reasons to NOT allow a user continue the claim process. Either because they have no active manager or because the Account is marked as 'cannot be claimed'.
screens.name: WarningNoManagerAssigned
screens.label: Warning No Manager Assigned

fields.name: dtCantBeClaimed
fields.fieldText:
This Account Cannot Be Claimed

Unfortunately, you cannot start a claim because this Account has already been claimed as part of another Account.

You can reach out to salesforce-claims@adyen.com, in case of any question.

fields.name: NoManagerAssignedYet
fields.fieldText:
No Manager Found

Unfortunately, we could not find an active manager for your user in Salesforce. You are only allowed to start this process if you have an active manager in Salesforce. Please reach out to commercialtools@adyen.com to set an active manager for your user.

textTemplates.name: txtClaimTeamNotification
textTemplates.text:
Just a heads up that {!GetUser.Name} is Claiming a Commission on the {!GetAccount.Name} Account.

You are also a Claim Member on this Account.


You can view this Claim here:

{!forClaimRecordLink}


Reach out to the Commercial Operations & Technology team in case this is a mistake or if you're marked as Ineligible to Claim when in fact you should be Eligible.


Thank you,

Business Operations & Technology Team

textTemplates.name: txtEligibleSalesLeadNotification
textTemplates.text:
Just a heads up that {!GetUser.Name} is Claiming a Commission on the {!GetAccount.Name} Account.

You have been selected as the Team Lead eligible to Claim Commission.


You can view this Claim here:

{!forClaimRecordLink}


Reach out to the Commercial Ops & Tech Team via this email address: salesforce-claims@adyen.com in case of any question.


Thank you,

Business Operations & Technology Team

textTemplates.name: txtStartClaim
textTemplates.text: Please note that by clicking next you are starting a claim for the Account {!GetAccount.Name}.
